posts.post_content:
0 stars all the way. First the Wizards bring out this card, followed by lots and lots of mass graveyard removal. They really didn't look much into the future when coming up with this card.  
  
What were they thinking? Let's make Reanimator decks less strong, since [Extirpate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Extirpate) is not enough yet?  
  
Instead I would love to see something supporting the use of graveyards: "your graveyard has shroud from spells or abilities your opponent controls"
posts.html:
0 stars all the way. First the Wizards bring out this card, followed by lots and lots of mass graveyard removal. They really didn't look much into the future when coming up with this card.

What were they thinking? Let's make Reanimator decks less strong, since Extirpate is not enough yet?

Instead I would love to see something supporting the use of graveyards: "your graveyard has shroud from spells or abilities your opponent controls"

posts.post_content: The weird thing about this card is that it can be used as yard hate against, for example, reanimator strategies, but it can still be used as an anti-hate card for decks that abuse the graveyard but they don't specifically target cards in it (example: [vengevine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vengevine)) to prevent things like [extirpate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=extirpate) and [deathrite shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=deathrite shaman) from ruining your day
posts.html:
